docs/basic-html/.title: HTML Introduction
docs/basic-html/.body:
Introduction to HTML
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the standard markup language used to create web pages. It provides the structure of a webpage and allows developers to embed text, images, videos, and other multimedia elements. HTML is the foundation of web development and is essential for creating any website or web application.
Key Features of HTML

Markup Language: HTML uses a system of tags to describe the structure and content of a webpage. Tags are enclosed in angle brackets, like , and are usually paired to mark the beginning and end of an element.
Elements and Attributes: HTML elements are the building blocks of a webpage. Each element can have attributes, which provide additional information about the element. For example,  includes src and alt attributes for the image element.
Semantic HTML: Modern HTML emphasizes the use of semantic tags, which provide meaning to the content they enclose. Examples include , , , and . Semantic HTML improves accessibility and SEO.
Cross-Platform: HTML is a platform-independent language, meaning it can be used to create web pages that are accessible on any device with a web browser.

Basic Structure of an HTML Document
An HTML document typically consists of the following structure:



    
    
    Document


    Hello, World!
    This is a simple HTML document.

docs/basic-html/02-tags.html.body:

📝 Text Formatting Tags

 to : Headings, from largest () to smallest ().

 / : Bold text.

: Underlined text.

: Subscript text.

🔗 Links and Media Tags

📦 Form Tags

🛠️ Interactive Elements

🧩 Inline and Block Elements

🔹 Block Elements

 to : Headings.

🖥️ Code and Preformatted Text

🔧 Meta Tags

: Metadata about the document (self-closing).
: External resources (self-closing).

: JavaScript.

docs/basic-html/03-text-formatting-tags..title: HTML Text Formatting Tags
docs/basic-html/03-text-formatting-tags..body:
🌟 Introduction
HTML text formatting tags are used to define and style the text content within an HTML document. These tags help in emphasizing, highlighting, and structuring the text, making it more readable and engaging. Below are detailed explanations of various text formatting tags along with examples.
💪 Bold and Importance

: Bold TextDescription: The  tag makes the enclosed text bold without adding any extra importance. This tag is purely for visual presentation and does not convey any special meaning to assistive technologies.Example:
This text is bold.

Rendered: This text is bold.

: Strong ImportanceDescription: The  tag indicates that the enclosed text is of strong importance or urgent. It not only makes the text bold but also conveys importance to assistive technologies like screen readers.Example:
This text is strongly important.

Rendered: This text is strongly important.


✨ Italics and Emphasis

: Italic TextDescription: The  tag italicizes the enclosed text without conveying any special emphasis or importance. It is used for stylistic purposes.Example:
This text is italic.

Rendered: This text is italic.

: Emphasized TextDescription: The  tag emphasizes the enclosed text, typically displaying it in italics. It conveys emphasis and stress to the text and can be nested for stronger emphasis.Example:
This text is emphasized.

Rendered: This text is emphasized.


📝 Underline and Small Text

: Underlined TextDescription: The  tag underlines the enclosed text. In modern HTML, it is used less frequently for stylistic purposes and more for denoting proper names or other terms that require underlining.Example:
This text is underlined.

Rendered: This text is underlined.

: Smaller TextDescription: The  tag renders the enclosed text in a smaller font size, typically for fine print, disclaimers, or other annotations.Example:
This text is smaller.

Rendered: This text is smaller.


🔶 Highlight and Deletion

: Highlighted TextDescription: The  tag highlights the enclosed text with a yellow background, indicating that the text is relevant or noteworthy.Example:
This text is highlighted.

Rendered: This text is highlighted.

: Deleted TextDescription: The  tag displays text that has been deleted or is no longer accurate, usually with a strikethrough.Example:
This text is deleted.

Rendered: This text is deleted.


📉 Subscript and Superscript

: Subscript TextDescription: The  tag renders the enclosed text as subscript, which is smaller and positioned below the baseline. It is often used for chemical formulas, mathematical expressions, and footnotes.Example:
H2O is the chemical formula for water.

Rendered: H2O is the chemical formula for water.

: Superscript TextDescription: The  tag renders the enclosed text as superscript, which is smaller and positioned above the baseline. It is often used for exponents, footnotes, and ordinal indicators.Example:
E = mc2 is Einstein's equation.

Rendered: E = mc2 is Einstein's equation.


💻 Code and Preformatted Text

: Inline CodeDescription: The  tag displays a short fragment of computer code in a monospace font. It is used for inline code snippets and does not preserve whitespace or line breaks.Example:
console.log('Hello, world!');

Rendered: console.log('Hello, world!');

: Preformatted TextDescription: The  tag displays preformatted text in a fixed-width font, preserving whitespace, line breaks, and indentation. It is useful for code blocks, ASCII art, and other text that requires exact formatting.Example:

function helloWorld() {
    console.log('Hello, world!');
}


Rendered:

function helloWorld() {
    console.log('Hello, world!');
}




⌨️ Keyboard Input and Sample Output

: Keyboard InputDescription: The  tag indicates text that represents user input from a keyboard, voice input, or any other text input device. It typically displays in a monospace font.Example:
Ctrl + C to copy.

Rendered: Ctrl + C to copy.

: Sample OutputDescription: The  tag represents sample output from a computer program. It is typically displayed in a monospace font and is used to indicate text that the user sees as output.Example:
Error: File not found.

Rendered: Error: File not found.


🧮 Variables

: VariableDescription: The  tag indicates a variable in a mathematical expression or programming context. It is typically displayed in italics.Example:x = y + 2

Rendered: x = y + 2

docs/basic-html/04-sementic-tags.html.title: HTML Sementic Tags
docs/basic-html/04-sementic-tags.html.body:
🔲 Semantic HTML5 Tags
🌟 Introduction
Semantic HTML5 tags provide meaning to the web page structure. They help improve the readability of the code and assist search engines and other devices in interpreting the content of web pages. Below are the key semantic HTML5 tags along with descriptions and examples.
🏠 Structural Elements

: Document or Section HeaderDescription: Represents introductory content or a set of navigational links.Example:

  Welcome to My Website
  
    
      Home
      About
      Contact
    
  



: Document or Section FooterDescription: Represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root element.Example:

  © 2024 My Website
  Privacy Policy




🗺️ Navigation and Content Sections

: Navigation LinksDescription: Represents a section of a page intended for navigation.Example:

  
    Home
    Services
    Contact
  



: Independent ContentDescription: Represents a self-contained composition in a document, page, application, or site.Example:

  Article Title
  This is an article about semantic HTML tags.




📚 Sections and Asides

: Section of ContentDescription: Represents a standalone section which doesn't have a more specific semantic element to represent it.Example:

  Section Title
  This is a section within the document.



: Side ContentDescription: Represents content that is tangentially related to the content around the aside element.Example:

  Related Information
  This is some additional information related to the main content.




🏞️ Media Content

: Media ContentDescription: Represents self-contained content, such as illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc.Example:

  
  This is an example image.



: Caption for Media ContentDescription: Represents a caption or legend for a  element.Example:

  
  This is an example image.




🔧 Main Content

: Main Content AreaDescription: Represents the dominant content of the  of a document.Example:
  Main Content Title
  This is the main content of the document.




🔖 Marking Text

: Highlighted TextDescription: Represents text that has been highlighted or marked for reference purposes.Example:You can use the mark element to highlight text.
